title: How to Divide Two Columns in Excel: Easy Step-by-Step Tutorial

steps.title: Open your project in Excel.
steps.content: Open your project in Excel. You can either open your project within Excel by navigating to File > Open or by right-clicking the file in Finder and selecting Open With > Excel .

steps.title: Select the column where you want to put the division results.
steps.content: Select the column where you want to put the division results. For example, if you want to divide column A by column B, you might select column C. Click the letter above a column to select all of its cells.

steps.title: Type "=A1/B1" in the formula bar.
steps.content: Type "=A1/B1" in the formula bar. Replace "A1" and "B1" with the actual cell locations you want to divide. For example, if you want to divide column A by column B and the first values appear in row 1, you'd use A1 and B1. Although you're entering specific cells now, you'll be applying the formula to the whole column in a moment. [1] X Research source The formula bar is right above the sheet.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+↵ Enter (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+⏎ Return (Mac).
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ↵ Enter (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + ⏎ Return (Mac). This divides the first cell by the second cell. To apply the calculation to the entire column, just drag the bottom-right corner of the quotient down the column to divide all cells in the columns. [2] X Research source
